entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued February 10 at 10:37PM AKST until February 11 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST SATURDAY ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COASTLINE... * WHAT...Blowing snow occurring. entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued February 10 at 2:12PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SATURDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is in effect until noon AKST Saturday. North Pole has a Stage 2 alert. Fairbanks has a Stage 1 alert. &&

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 10 at 11:59AM AKST until February 12 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 40 below zero to 50 below zero.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued February 10 at 3:19PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR EXTREME GRASSLAND FIRE DANGER FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 032...033...047... 048 AND 050... The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a Fire Weather Watch for extreme grassland fire danger, which is in effect Friday afternoon.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued February 10 at 2:34PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Friday Afternoon... .Strong northwest winds behind a cold front combined with a dry airmass could promote critical fire weather conditions across parts of the local area Friday afternoon. The most prone areas will be along and south of a line extending from Arapahoe Nebraska to Beloit Kansas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 4:30AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty Southwest Winds Today... Sustained southwest winds will increase to 10 to 15 mph by this afternoon, with wind gusts of 30 to 35 mph at times. Winds this strong could blow around any loose, unsecured objects. Additionally, driving could become difficult on east to west oriented roads, especially for high profile vehicles.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 3:59AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Moderate to Heavy Snow Moving Across Lower Michigan... Moderate to heavy snowfall is moving across southwest Lower Michigan early this morning. The snow is expected to end by 9 am and turn to drizzle but not before a couple of inches of snow accumulate. Visibilities have fallen to a half mile at many locations and roads have become slick.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 3:30AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Covered Roads This Morning... Snow will persist through the morning rush hour. Total snowfall between 4 AM and 8 AM will be around an inch. Temperatures will slowly rise into the lower 30s by daybreak. With temperatures in the upper 20s at the start of the snow, roads will be snow covered and slick this morning. Drivers should proceed with caution.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 3:30AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Covered Roads This Morning... Snow will overspread the region between 4 AM and 6 AM this morning. While temperatures will rise into the low 30s toward daybreak, temperatures will be in the upper 20s at the onset of the snow. So once the snow begins, it will quickly accumulate onto roads. Drivers will need to use caution this morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Genesee; Huron; Lapeer; Livingston; Oakland; Sanilac; Tuscola; Washtenaw

cap:geocode.value: MIZ049 MIZ054 MIZ055 MIZ061 MIZ062 MIZ068 MIZ069 MIZ075

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 3:30AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Will Move into the Area This Morning.... Snow will overspread the region between 5 AM and 7 AM this morning. Temperatures will rise toward the freezing mark by 7 AM, with temperatures rising steady thereafter. The intensity of the snow may still be enough to accumulate onto the roads. Drivers should plan on slick conditions developing during the morning
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lenawee; Macomb; Monroe; St. Clair; Wayne

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued February 10 at 2:34PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Friday Afternoon... .Strong northwest winds behind a cold front combined with a dry airmass could promote critical fire weather conditions across parts of the local area Friday afternoon. The most prone areas will be along and south of a line extending from Arapahoe Nebraska to Beloit Kansas.
